name: Jason Teitelman
title: Software Developer & Observability Engineer
bio: Hi, I'm Jason! I'm a pragmatic developer with a strong background in C#, observability engineering, and modern web development. I’m passionate about building scalable systems and improving software reliability.
longBio:
With years of hands-on experience across the software development lifecycle, I've contributed to everything from legacy system maintenance to observability pipelines and cloud-based personal projects. My focus has been in enterprise environments where reliability, clarity, and visibility are essential.

My toolkit includes C#, React.js, PowerShell, and Datadog, but I’m equally comfortable writing automation with Ansible or scripting complex analysis in SQL. I care deeply about system health, developer efficiency, and making complexity manageable.

Outside of code, I explore creative outlets like guitar, poetry, and digital art. I’m currently focused on personal growth and building a life aligned with purpose and integrity.

experience.description: Maintained and optimized C# APIs in a large legacy application. Built features with React.js, implemented unit/integration tests, and created observability dashboards with Datadog.
Deployed Datadog across Windows/Linux servers using Ansible, developed Splunk dashboards, and improved incident response strategies.
Automated PowerShell data processing workflows, validated enhancements, and troubleshot batch file issues in AL3 and XML.
Used SQL and Tableau to support reporting integrity, mapped data lineage for governance, and led quality assurance initiatives for EDW-driven reports.
Wrote Ruby and VBA scripts to clean and transform mail data, analyzed USPS error trends, and created automation to improve workflow efficiency.

education.degree: Bachelor of Arts in Economics, Minor in Mathematics
